summary.span: 表示部门中的时间（如周、月和年）。

span.span: Represents time in divisions, such as weeks, months, and years.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日历将时间划分为单位，如周、 月和年。A calendar divides time into units, such as weeks, months, and years. 在每个日历不同数、 长度和划分的开始。The number, length, and start of the divisions vary in each calendar. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET Framework 中使用的日历类的信息，请参阅[使用日历](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 任何时间点可以表示为一组使用特定日历的数字值。Any moment in time can be represented as a set of numeric values using a particular calendar. 例如，春分发生 (1999 年，3、 20、 8、 46、 0、 0.0) 在公历日历中，即 1999 年 3 月 20，公元For example, a vernal equinox occurred at (1999, 3, 20, 8, 46, 0, 0.0) in the Gregorian calendar, that is, March 20, 1999 C.E. 在 8:46:00:0.0。at 8:46:00:0.0. 实现可以将特定日历的范围中的任何日期映射到一组类似的数字值，并可以将这种集的数字值映射到使用中的信息的文本表示形式和。An implementation of can map any date in the range of a specific calendar to a similar set of numeric values, and can map such sets of numeric values to a textual representation using information from and . 文本表示形式可以是区分区域性的例如，"8:46 AM 年 3 月 20 1999 AD"对于 EN-US 区域性，或不区分区域性的例如，"1999年-03-20T08:46:00"采用 ISO 8601 格式。The textual representation can be culture-sensitive, for example, "8:46 AM March 20th 1999 AD" for the en-US culture, or culture-insensitive, for example, "1999-03-20T08:46:00" in ISO 8601 format. 一个实现可以定义一个或多个纪元。A implementation can define one or more eras. 类标识的纪元为枚举的整数，其中当前纪元 () 具有值 0。The class identifies the eras as enumerated integers, where the current era () has the value 0. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 若要弥补的日历年和 sun 围绕一个地球旋转的实际时间或全收围绕地球旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年必须从标准日历年不同数量的天。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个实现以不同的方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 为了保持一致，每个间隔 （第一个月，例如） 中的第一个单元分配值 1。For consistency, the first unit in each interval (the first month, for example) is assigned the value 1. 命名空间包括以下实现：The namespace includes the following implementations: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示的成员类。The following code example demonstrates the members of the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在日历中支持闰月的概念，特定月后或在一年中的任何月份之后发生的闰月。In a calendar that supports the notion of a leap month, the leap month can occur either after a particular month or after any month in a year. 例如，方法返回一个数字，介于 1 到 13，该值指示指定日期与关联的月份之间。For example, the method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. 如果，在一年的第八个和第九个月之间存在闰月方法的第八个月内，闰第 8 个月的 9 和 10 中的第九个月返回 8。If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是可以用两位数年份表示的 100 年范围内的最后一年。 is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. 通过查找两位数字的唯一匹配项来确定在世纪`year`该 100 年范围内。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit `year` within that 100-year range. 例如，如果设置为 2029，则 100 年范围是从 1930 年至 2029年。For example, if is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 1930 年，而 29 一个 2 位值被解释为 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 如果`year`大于或等于 100，值`year`不经更改即返回。If `year` is greater than or equal to 100, the value of `year` is returned unchanged. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 传递一个两位数的年份值 (小于 100) 导致该方法将值转换为四位数字值根据值，该值表示相应的纪元。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供对在支持的日历范围内的四位数年份值，该方法返回的实际输入的值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 如果应用程序提供支持的日历范围之外的四位数字值或提供一个负值，则该方法将引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

exception.span: 超出了日历支持的范围。

span.span: is outside the range supported by the calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性允许两位数年份，以正确转换为四位数年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 例如，如果此属性设置为 2029年，100 年范围是从 1930 年到 2029 年。For example, if this property is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 1930 年，而 29 一个 2 位值被解释为 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 此属性的初始值被派生自控制面板的区域和语言选项部分中的设置。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 但是，该信息可以更改的生命周期内。However, that information can change during the life of the . 类不检测系统设置中的更改自动。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 如果日历不支持的区域和语言选项中，此属性的初始值是通过定义的默认值类。If the calendar is not supported in the regional and language options, the initial value of this property is the default value defined by the class. 你的应用程序应将此值设置为 99，以指示是按字面 2 位数字的年份。Your application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 例如，如果此属性设置为 99，100 年范围是从 0 （不是有效值对于大多数日历） 到 99。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.
